Cases underwent clinical examination at admission, at 24 h, and at 48 h (if the child was still hospitalised) including assessments of respiratory signs, anthropomorphic measurements, and peripheral oxygen saturation (on room air whenever possible). 15, 18 We assessed the vital status of cases during a follow-up visit or telephone interview done 30 days after admission (with a window of 21â€“90 days). Controls were similarly assessed for clinical findings at enrolment but had no follow-up assessment.
18 Clinical definitions used in analyses are described in the appendix.
